thread.title: Quarantined Parise, Pominville out for Wild with mumps

author: AP
title: Quarantined Parise, Pominville out for Wild with mumps
text:
Let friends in your social network know what you are reading about Facebook Email Quarantined Parise, Pominville out for Wild with mumps Minnesota Wild forwards Zach Parise and Jason Pominville have been diagnosed with mumps Post to Facebook Quarantined Parise, Pominville out for Wild with mumps Minnesota Wild forwards Zach Parise and Jason Pominville have been diagnosed with mumps Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2lO43Sc Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address.   Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Quarantined Parise, Pominville out for Wild with mumps AP 8:19 p.m. ET Feb. 27, 2017 CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
ST. PAUL, Minn. (AP) â€” Minnesota Wild forwards Zach Parise and Jason Pominville have been diagnosed with mumps and must miss at least three games. 
The Wild announced Monday, shortly before faceoff against Los Angeles, that Parise and Pominville have the highly contagious virus along with other members of the organization. The veteran wings have been placed in isolation for a five-day period, meaning they'll at least miss games Tuesday at Winnipeg and Thursday at Columbus. 
The Wild said players and staff were recently provided with a measles-mumps-rubella vaccination. 
Vancouver played Saturday night without five players because of the mumps or symptoms associated with the virus. 
With Parise and Pominville out, forwards Martin Hanzal and Ryan White made their well-timed debuts Monday after being acquired Sunday in a trade with Arizona.
